        .rst(rst),

        .ad2(ad2)
    );

module ins_p1 (
    input clk,
    input rst,
    input [7:0] data,
    input [1:0] fetch,
    output reg [2:0] ins,
    output reg [4:0] ad1
);
    always @(posedge clk or negedge rst) begin
        if (!rst) begin
            ins <= 3'b0;
            ad1 <= 5'b0;
        end
        else begin
            if (fetch == 2'b01) begin
                ins <= data[7:5];
                ad1 <= data[4:0];
            end
            else begin
                ins <= ins;
                ad1 <= ad1;
            end
        end
    end
endmodule
module ins_p2 (
    input clk,
    input rst,
    input [7:0] data,
    input [1:0] fetch,
    output reg [7:0] ad2
);
    always @(posedge clk or negedge rst) begin
        if (!rst) begin
            ad2 <= 8'b0;
        end
        else begin
            if (fetch == 2'b10) begin
                ad2 <= data;
            end
            else begin
                ad2 <= ad2;
            end
        end
    end
endmodule

module multiplier(
    input clk,
    input rst,
    input [7:0] x,
    input [7:0] y,
    output reg [15:0] p

    d1 [7:0]: 8-bit data input from path 1.
    d2 [7:0]: 8-bit data input from path 2.

Output ports:
    data_out [7:0]: 8-bit data output reflecting the selected input data.

Implementation:
    The data multiplexer utilizes three submodules, each handling one data input path.
    Based on the selection signal sel:
    - If sel is 3'b000, data is fetched from the first path (mux_path0).
    - If sel is 3'b001, data is fetched from the second path (mux_path1).
    - If sel is 3'b010, data is fetched from the third path (mux_path2).
    The output data_out is assigned the output from the active submodule based on the selection signal.

);

module accu (
    input               clk,
    input               rst_n,
    input       [7:0]   data_in,
    input               valid_in,

    output              valid_out,
    output      [9:0]   data_out
);
    wire [3:0] u_counter_out;
    wire [9:0] u_data_accumulator_out;
    wire u_valid_output_out;
    u_counter u_counter (
        .clk      (clk),
        .rst_n    (rst_n),
        .valid_in (valid_in),
        .out      (u_counter_out)
    );
    u_data_accumulator u_data_accumulator (
        .clk      (clk),
        .rst_n    (rst_n),
        .valid_in (valid_in),
        .data_in  (data_in),
        .out      (u_data_accumulator_out)
    );
    u_valid_output u_valid_output (
        .clk      (clk),
        .rst_n    (rst_n),
        .valid_in (valid_in),
        .counter_out (u_counter_out),
        .out      (u_valid_output_out)
    );
    assign valid_out = u_valid_output_out;
    assign data_out = u_data_accumulator_out;
endmodule
module u_counter (
    input               clk,
    input               rst_n,
    input               valid_in,
    output reg    [3:0] out
);
    always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
        if (~rst_n) begin
            out <= 0;
        end else begin
            if (valid_in) begin
                if (out == 4) begin
                    out <= 0;
                end else begin
                    out <= out + 1;
                end
            end
        end
    end
endmodule
module u_data_accumulator (
    input               clk,
    input               rst_n,
    input               valid_in,
    input       [7:0]   data_in,
    output reg    [9:0] out
);
    always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
        if (~rst_n) begin
            out <= 0;
        end else begin
            if (valid_in) begin
                out <= out + data_in;
            end
        end
    end
endmodule
module u_valid_output (
    input               clk,
    input               rst_n,
    input               valid_in,
    input       [3:0]   counter_out,
    output reg          out
);
    always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
        if (~rst_n) begin
            out <= 0;
        end else begin
            if (valid_in) begin
                if (counter_out == 4) begin
                    out <= 1;
                end else begin
                    out <= 0;
                end
            end
        end
    end
endmodule

nodes: [A input, B input, A_greater output, A_equal output, A_less output, sub_inst submodule], 
connectivity: [[1, 0, 5, 1, 0, 5], [5, 5, 2, 3, 3, 4]]
, Implement a module of a 32-bit comparator using submodules with multiple bit-level comparators in combinational logic.

Module name:
    comparator_32bit

Input ports:
    A [31:0]: First 32-bit input operand (binary number to compare).
    B [31:0]: Second 32-bit input operand (binary number to compare).
Output ports:
    A_greater: 1-bit output indicating if A is greater than B.
    A_equal: 1-bit output indicating if A is equal to B.
    A_less: 1-bit output indicating if A is less than B.

Implementation:
Comparison Logic: The module compares the two 32-bit binary numbers A and B using combinational logic.
A subtraction operation is performed: A - B. The result of this subtraction helps determine whether A is greater than, equal to, or less than B.
Carry Generation: If a borrow occurs during the subtraction, A is less than B (A_less).
If no borrow occurs and the result of subtraction is non-zero, A is greater than B (A_greater).
If A and B are equal, the result of subtraction is zero (A_equal).
Modular Design:
The main module (comparator_32bit) instantiates a submodule (subtractor_32bit) that performs the actual subtraction.
The outputs (A_greater, A_equal, A_less) are mutually exclusive, ensuring only one of the three outputs is high (1) at any given time.

Give me the complete code.
module comparator_32bit(
    input [31:0] A,   // First 32-bit input operand
    input [31:0] B,   // Second 32-bit input operand
    output A_greater, 
    output A_equal,   
    output A_less     
);
    wire [31:0] diff;
    subtractor_32bit sub_inst(.A(A), .B(B), .diff(diff));
    assign A_greater = diff[31];
    assign A_equal = ~|diff;
    assign A_less = ~diff[31];
endmodule
module subtractor_32bit(
    input [31:0] A,
    input [31:0] B,
    output [31:0] diff
);
    assign diff = A - B;
endmodule

// Internal signals declaration
  reg [15:0] a, b; // Multiplicand and multiplier registers
  reg [4:0] shift_count; // Shift count register
  reg [31:0] product; // Product register
  reg done; // Chip output flag
  // Control Unit
  always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
    if (!rst_n) begin
      shift_count <= 5'b0; // Reset the shift count register
      done <= 1'b0; // Reset the done flag
    end else begin
      if (start) begin
        shift_count <= 5'b0; // Start the multiplication operation
        done <= 1'b0; // Reset the done flag
      end else if (shift_count == 5'd16) begin
        done <= 1'b1; // Set the done flag on the last shift
      end
    end
  end
  // Register Unit
  always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
    if (!rst_n) begin
      a <= 16'b0; // Reset the multiplicand register
      b <= 16'b0; // Reset the multiplier register
    end else begin
      if (start) begin
        a <= ain; // Load the multiplicand register with input a
        b <= bin; // Load the multiplier register with input b
      end
    end
  end
  // Multiplier Unit
  always @(posedge clk or negedge rst_n) begin
    if (!rst_n) begin
      product <= 32'b0; // Reset the product register
    end else begin
      if (start) begin
        product <= {16'b0, b}; // Initialize the product register with the multiplier
      end else begin
        if (product[0]) begin
          product <= product + a; // Accumulate the product with the shifted multiplier
        end
        product <= product >> 1; // Shift the product register
      end
    end
  end
  // Output Assignment
  assign yout = product; // Assign the final product output
  assign done = done; // Assign the done flag
endmodule
